Key Match Events: Curry added five more points, making a couple of free throws and knocking down a buzzer-beating three-point shot to end the first half.
Steph Curry popped off for 15 points to start the second half.
Ultimately, the Warriors came out on top 125-112.
Pre-Game Insights: Curry returned on Monday after missing three games due to a left peroneal strain.
Curry played under restricted minutes, but still came out as Golden State’s best player.
Despite having a quiet start on offense, Curry popped off in the third quarter scoring 15 points in the period alone.
Post-Match Reflections: Curry had a huge comeback game with 24 points, six assists, and three rebounds.
Buddy Hield once again proved why he’s the second option for Golden State as he came up with an all-around performance adding 20 points, five rebounds, two steals, and one block.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Golden State Warriors notched their fourth consecutive victory and second straight on the road after beating the Washington Wizards on Monday.
